question: 口癖
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>mouth</kanji> <kanji>habit</kanji> is something you say with your mouth a lot. It's a habit. It's your <vocabulary>favorite phrase</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>catchphrase</vocabulary>. Many people have the <vocabulary>habit of saying</vocabulary> the certain things over and over again, whether they want to or not.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the kun'yomi vocab reading of both kanji. <ja>癖</ja> is the reading you learned with the kanji. Watch out for the rendaku.
